decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa into play from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Tainted Indulgence. By combining instant speed reanimation spells with disruptive cards like Solitude and Grief, the deck can control the board while setting up its combo. Support cards like Ephemerate and Faithful Mending help with card advantage and protection. The deck also includes a small amount of disruption and removal to deal with opponent threats. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficient reanimation and combo potential.

This deck revolves around utilizing Martyr of Sands as a key combo piece to gain a large amount of life quickly, while also employing aggressive creatures and removal spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck focuses on protecting its key pieces and disrupting the opponent's game plan, while also having the ability to finish the game with a large life total thanks to cards like Solitude and Abiding Grace. The deck also includes cards like Emeria, the Sky Ruin and Skyclave Apparition for added value and versatility.

The deck focuses on using control elements and artifact synergy to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through card advantage and tokens. Urza and Urza's Saga are key cards that allow for powerful mana production and artifact recursion, while Stoneforge Mystic and Thopter Foundry combine with Sword of the Meek to create a steady stream of tokens. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Pithing Needle and Esper Sentinel to control the board and protect its win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through its control and artifact synergy.

The key concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Combo - Living End deck is to cycle through cards to fill the graveyard with creatures, then use Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once, overwhelming the opponent with a powerful board presence. The deck utilizes cards like Curator of Mysteries and Grief to cycle through the deck quickly, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety. The deck aims to win the game by assembling a strong board presence that the opponent struggles to deal with effectively.

This Landless Combo deck focuses on generating mana quickly through rituals and card draw to cast spells like Goblin Charbelcher and Irencrag Feat, enabling explosive win conditions without relying on traditional lands. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Pact of Negation to control the game and protect its key pieces. With a mix of ramp, card filtering, and powerful combo pieces, this deck aims to quickly assemble its win conditions and overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan.
